intro: Trigonella plagioneura, commonly known as the narrow-leafed fenugreek, is a flowering plant belonging to the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which are narrow and often have a hairy texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in clusters, followed by small, flat pods that contain several seeds. Native to regions of southern Europe and the Middle East, it thrives in sandy or calcareous soils. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been used in traditional herbal medicine for various health purposes.
